definition: variant of 糊塗|糊涂[hu2 tu5]
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
surname Hu
to apply (paint etc)/to smear/to daub/to blot out/to scribble/to scrawl/(literary) mud/street
blunderer/bungler/also written 糊塗蟲|糊涂虫

sentences.english: They asked me so many questions that they confused me.
sentences.chinese: 他們問我那末多問題把我都弄胡塗了。
這個成語把我搞胡塗了。

sentences.english: His explanation mixed me up even more.
sentences.chinese: 他的解釋讓我更胡塗了。

sentences.english: Does a man live through his whole life in confusion?
sentences.chinese: 人的一生就這樣胡里胡塗地度過嗎？

sentences.english: Was Plato confused, ? was he contradicting himself, ? was he, what was he doing?
sentences.chinese: 柏拉圖胡塗了嗎，自我矛盾了嗎，他在幹嗎？

sentences.english: It was stupid of you to turn it upside down without closing the lid.
sentences.chinese: 你沒有蓋上蓋子就把它倒過來，真是糊胡塗。

sentences.english: Because of mismanagement, his business has gone to hell.
sentences.chinese: 因爲管理不善，他的生意搞得一塌胡塗，不可收拾。

sentences.english: The blundering missioner doing communication like above will certainly bring misfortune to himself as well.
sentences.chinese: 這種胡塗使者哪有不給自己帶來災難的。

sentences.english: Now we seem to be completely confused.
sentences.chinese: 現在我們完全被搞胡塗了。

sentences.english: You can't lose the plot, dear. Health is more important than playing.
sentences.chinese: 別犯胡塗，親愛的，健康可比玩兒重要。

sentences.english: I was messed up for a longtime.
I'm not sure if I made my answer clear. I may have confused you.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道我的回答是否清楚，也許我讓你胡塗了。

sentences.english: He ended up puking all over the taxi last night.
sentences.chinese: 他昨晚最後在出租車上吐得一蹋胡塗。

sentences.english: I was muddled by too much advice.
sentences.chinese: 提供的意見太多，把我弄胡塗了。

sentences.english: You wander: your head becomes confused.
sentences.chinese: 你神經錯亂，頭腦胡塗了。

sentences.english: I am mixed up about these confusing directions.
sentences.chinese: 我被這些混亂的指示弄胡塗了。

definition: ugly/shameful/to ridicule
leisurely/unhurried/sluggish
to make a fool of oneself
overtones in conversation/things indirectly implied from what is said
Six Records of a Floating Life, autobiographical novel and description of Qing dynasty life by 沈復|沈复[Shen3 Fu4], published 1808
(slang) (Tw) to bullshit/to fool
confused/vague/indistinct/muddle-headed/mixed up/in a daze
lit. small abacus/fig. selfish calculations/bean-counting
moorhen (genus Gallinula)/gallinule/frog
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
to mention/to bring up (a subject)/with regard to/as for
lit. 300 silver taels not hidden here (idiom); fig. to reveal what one intends to hide
pinyin: ci3 di4 wu2 yin2 san1 bai3 liang3

definition: shameless
shameless/(slang) rascal
La Comédie humaine, series of novels by 19th century French novelist Honoré de Balzac 巴爾扎克|巴尔扎克[Ba1 er3 zha1 ke4]
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
